Fields.DialogueText: Greetings, Captain. My name is Minneapolis. From this day forward, I'll be under your command.

Fields.MenuText: That's what I call a welcome wagon. Good to have you.
This isn't the first day of school, you know.
For some reason I was expecting more winter wear.

Fields.DialogueText: A good welcome wagon opens the door to a lot of things. I hope that helps me figure you out better, Captain!
It may not be, but manners do make a person. I'm unsure if you know of my namesake, Captain, but from where I come: they're expected.
I'm good with winter, trust me! Oh, and if you need help on choosing what to wear during the winter or some ideas for winter food, let me know!
I don't think I've met someone this overtly polite in my whole career.
Well, you should get used to it! Nice Minneapolis is here to stay. ... Actually, Captain, I have a question?
Ask away, Minneapolis.
Captain, do you or the crew have any tastes for any particular Midwestern dish? I'm trying to prepare for the next "booyah party."
Boo-ya-what?
You've never heard of a "booyah party" before, Captain!? They're amazing. Food, dancing, talking, and celebrating the common worker! You don't have to come, but I'd love to see you there.
Sure, I don't see why not. When are you hosting this party?
It'll be this Friday. I usually host them on Saturdays. Given the crew's need for quiet relaxation on Saturdays, however, I decided to move it to Friday.
I'll be sure to be there.
Excellent! Now, again, if I could please get your personal opinion on which main dish I should choose? I was thinking chicken wild rice soup. It has such a good flavor for this time of year...
Personally, I like squa-- Damn it. A Morgana already?
Uff da. ... Actually, this is a great opportunity. Captain, would you mind me showing off my skills so that you can see what you're working with?
I'd be glad to see them. Let's roll.
@BATTLE
Hello, Captain, are you busy right this moment?
Not any less busy than I used to be. What's up?
Well, I hate to interrupt your work, but how do you feel about home cooking?

Fields.MenuText: Sign me the hell up. Where is it at?
I haven't had home cooking in the longest time.
I never really gave it much thought. Why?

Fields.DialogueText: Hahaha! If you love the idea of that, then you're going to love this next part.
Then you're in for a treat...
Well! I think that what I'm offering may change your mind, if not make your tongue start watering!
Here, try this! It's homemade apple turnover with some Granny Smith apples I happened to pick from last mission.
*munch munch*
Aha! That smile says it all, doesn't it? You like them?
Like is an understatement. This is amazing. Where'd you learn how to make this?
Baking is in my soul, Captain. It's something everyone needs to know, so why not be good at it? And from the way you're still smiling, I'd say I'm doing well.
That's for sure. What else have you got made?
I've made some sausage and potato casserole for tonight's dinner. Would you be interested in trying that?
Does a ship tread on water?
Depends, is the captain in charge of the ship? ... Nah, I'm just giving you a hard time, Captain!
I think I see somebody else you could give a hard time towards. They're coming up now.
Time for some home cooking.
Let's go!
@BATTLE
Captain, I'm still concerned. I haven't made a main dish yet for the booyah party and I'm rather pink.
I thought you said you were going to make chicken wild rice soup?
I was all set to do that, but then I noticed that our stock of potatoes was abnormally high. Therefore, I think some good old cottage pie is in order!
Cottage pie? Isn't that like shepherd's pie except there's ground beef instead of lamb?
Exactly! I'm going to make a lot of it since it's the first booyah party we're going to have on this crew.

Fields.MenuText: I've been meaning to ask about that. How do these parties go?
What about the chicken wild rice soup? I was looking forward to it.
Isn't that a bit filling for a party?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I'd be glad to tell you!
Oh don't worry, there will be plenty of time in the future for that. Trust me on that one. That being said, the party's setup is the next priority.
You cannot party on an empty stomach, Captain! That's just common sense.
Basically, we'll get a bunch of tents set up on deck, have everyone pick their own from a hat, and then host the party! Then, every sailor who attended cleans up in the morning. Simple, no?
Logistically, that sounds hellish. How do you keep them all in order?
You get the number you get and you don't pitch a fit. It's really that simple. Though, I know some rowdy boys will try to break that rule. I wouldn't worry about that too much, however.
And why would you say that?
I'll know just what to say. I have a gentle hand, but that doesn't mean I don't know how to get people to see my way.
Are you sure you don't need any help?
As I said before, you don't have to help or come if you don't want to, but I'd love to see you there.
Don't you worry, I'll be there. Let me go make plans after we deal with this Morgana.
Uff da. They practically snuck up on us! Well, too bad for them - I'm not one for surprises.
@BATTLE
Good to see you as well, Minneapolis. I just finished prayer.
Whether it be to God almighty or the Great Spirit, I hope both bless us today. Have you had anything to eat yet, Joe?
No, I have not. Do you have any of that leftover chicken wild rice? I would very much like that.
Sure! It's still in the Mess Hall 2-B. Don't take too much now, I want to save some for others.
Share and share alike, as they say. See you soon, Minneapolis.
See you, Joe! ... Ah, what a nice young lad. Does me proud to see how far he's come.
'Scuse me, are you Minneapolis? Name's Marcus, I'm a sailor. I've heard you've got some great home cooking. Do you have any right now? Just got back from a shakedown.
Oh, yes, I am, M-Marcus... Err, yes... I've heard you folk enjoy chicken. I happen to have a pot of chicken wild rice still in Mess Hall 2-B. ... But I think we've run out of waffles.
... Yeah... Listen, I'll go see about that soup. Thank you for offering. I-I've got to jet.
Oh! See you later, Mar-- Oh, he's gone already.
Well isn't that something, huh?
Oh! Captain! How long have you been standing there? ...Actually, forget that. I was just guiding them to the mess hall. Did you want some food, too?

Fields.MenuText: What's wrong with Marcus? Did he do something bad to you?
... Are you scared of Marcus, Minneapolis?
Minneapolis... you shouldn't have said that to Marcus.

Fields.DialogueText: N-No! Marcus did nothing of the sort. I just... I don't know much about them.
Marcus doesn't scare me one bit, nor does any sailor on this vessel! ... It's just not often that I run into... you know.
Did I do something wrong? I've heard that they're very particular to that type of food.
Have you never talked to a black person before, Minneapolis? It's okay if you haven't, but you can't just go assuming stuff about people like that.
I'm sorry, Captain, I've never met one before. ... Ergh, I guess that could've gone better. ... Could you please explain to me what I can do to feel safer? Er, perhaps more polite to Marcus?
I'd be all right with teaching you that. Though, I'd have to do it after this engagement. It looks like we've got company.
@BATTLE
Ah! Joe, you're up early!
BOOYAH! PARTY! BOOYAH! BOOYAH! BOOYAH!
Huh, I never thought I'd be at a party like this. It's kind of chaotic.
Thanks to your suggestions, Captain, I was able to get a lot more people on board. Though, I think the added dishes I picked up may have helped, too.

Fields.MenuText: This is... Southern cooking!
Is that some... kugel?
Of all the things I expected to see here, sanbeiji wasn't one of them.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you enjoy it, Captain! It's my first time doing green beans and sweet potatoes. I asked some of Marcus's crewmates for advice on it.
Why, yes - it is! As a matter of fact, one of the crewmates from my namesake helped me put it together. He's a passionate young lad, but he's also got a bit of an accent.
It was certainly a weird dish to prepare. I've never seen cooking techniques quite like that. But I'm glad to add it to my repertoire.
This is a big step up from a couple days ago, Minneapolis.
Oh, my stars... Captain, you don't have to congratulate me on anything. After all, you helped me open up a bit.
Heya! Captain! I didn't know parties like this were your type of thing. ... Oh, hey, Minneapolis.
Marcus! It's good to see you. Are you enjoying the party? How about the food?
Those sweet potatoes are something else! The green beans are a little bit crunchy, but, there's always next time.
W-Would you give me some advice on how to make them better? I'd think someone like you would know how?
"Someone like me..." Phahaha! Yeah, yeah. Anyway, thanks for the party, Minneapolis. S-See you. Ah, you too, Captain.
W-Wait! Marcus! ... Grgh.
Eh, you almost had it. We just need to put in some more work. This is still a big step, but you've got to stop assuming.
I-It's hard, Captain. There's just so much I don't know about them. What should I do?
Why not just ask like you would with any other person? You did it with food. You can do it with culture, too. ... Minneapolis, are you ok? You have a scowl on your face.
Morganas... interrupting... my... Grrr. Hm! Captain, we have some rabblerousers. Would you mind if I played the role of the bouncer?
Sign me the hell up. Let's roll.
@BATTLE
Eliezer, please. Listen to reason. You need to know that you can't go that far with the mechanics. They're a part of this ship, too.
As if! If they're not going to be right in the head, I have the right to tell them that! What the hell are they thinking, putting us in low power when we're trying to do weapon exercises!?
You need to take a step back, Eliezer. They had their reasons to conserve power, we can't control that.
The hell I have to! Who are you to tell me that I'm going too far?! I have half a mind to go down there and--
Eliezer, do you want to go down there and perhaps clean up after them, then?
Wait, wha--
Oh no, don't think of it like I'm comparing you to them—no, not at all. I think some good time down there could serve you well.
Hey... Minneapolis, you're kind of close-
Close? Why, you shouldn't close your fists when you're about to fight, Eliezer! Or, maybe you'd prefer to mop down there? I hear it's quite slick, and it's very easy to break your body...
M-Minneapolis, you're--
Oh! Better yet maybe you could clean the latrines down there! I'd imagine it doesn't smell too good, what with the engine room being hot... You'd probably gasp for air...
N-No, ma'am...
Then you shouldn't be picking fights with people you don't understand, Eliezer. Now. Go cool off up deck, and please don't bring this hotheaded nonsense to me again?
Y-Yes, ma'am! S-Sorry to bring it up!
Ha... Troublesome kids, aren't they? Hello, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Damn, I've heard about "Minnesota Nice" before, but I didn't know the half of it.
Don't mind me. I wish I would've brought popcorn.

Fields.DialogueText: "Minnesota Nice?" What's that? Either way, Captain, I'm sorry you had to see that.
I thought I made some last week? Perhaps I should try kettle corn this time? Anyway, I'm sorry you had to see that, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: That was hardcore and yet so polite. How do you do that?

Fields.DialogueText: You must try your best to be polite when you can. And even when you find yourself angry you must express it with respect. Er, sorry you had to see that, Captain.
It's good to see that you know when to put your foot down. That's a good quality a lot of rookie captains don't have.
I wish I didn't have to do it. There's a lot of good people on this ship, Captain. They just need a bit more guidance.
I know how that is... Oh, great. Minneapolis, would you mind being "nice" to the Morganas incoming?
Not at all! I'd be glad to teach some manners.
@BATTLE
The steam blowing in your face, your fingers burning at the touch of the engine...
Would you like to help clean up down there?
Hehe! Captain, Captain! Look here, I just got this today! Isn't this jersey wonderful?

Fields.MenuText: Minneapolis Marines? Never heard of them.
The Marines? Didn't they disband... years ago?
Wait, who are the Marines? Minor league baseball?

Fields.DialogueText: You haven't!? They were the city of Minneapolis' football team from '03 to '24! Then they came back as the Red Jackets later on, but... I love the Marines' jerseys and now I finally have one.
Technically they did, though they were the Red Jackets at that time. I'm so glad to finally have one of my favorite jerseys that my namesake produced!
They were popular back then! I never got to hear their first game when they played, but I wish I could've.
That is a really nice jersey, actually. Are you going to hang it up on your wall?
Well, let me answer your question, Captain. Have you ever heard of the Minneapolis Institute Of Arts?
I... think I have. Don't they collect everything from here and there? Art, memorabilia, cars?
That's right! They collect all manner of things, but the most important thing is that it's all artistic at the end of the day.
But why would they collect so much of it? ... Er, rather, what's it all for?
Well, Captain. Art is not only something that you look at, interpret, or admire. In truth, art is like a soul's gate: an expression of oneself.
Expressing yourself? It sounds like a good time.
Would you like to try pyrography, Captain? It's something I do quite often myself. Basically, it's like creating pictures by singing wood.
Sounds amazing. Maybe we can do some later today?
I'd love to show you some, Captain. It's very relaxing with the torch... Hmph! It looks like I may have to show some fire sooner than anticipated.
And just like that, more Morganas. Well, I guess it's more of a hands-on lesson then?
I agree, Captain. Step 1: Prepare your torch. Step 2: Steady your hand. Step 3: The first burn!
@BATTLE
It's something you can love, be inspired by, and create - big or small.
Good afternoon, Feng! How goes your patrol? Are you eating well? You look rather thin.
... One question at a time please, Minneapolis. Yes, patrol is going rather well. Eating wise, I'm fine.
... Are you sure you don't have a cold or something, Feng? You sound a little nasally.
I beg your pardon?
Oh, you don't have to beg anything. I just am wondering if you have a cold or anything? You're speaking really thick and through your nose.
... That's just how I talk, I don't see the big deal with it.
It just sounds weird to me. Are you for certain you don't have a cold? You're sort of extending your 'os' and adding 'as' where they shouldn't be--
I think I'll go back to my post now. See you, Minneapolis.
A-Ah! Wait, Feng! Come back! I didn't...! ... Damn it.
Minneapolis...
Don't you "Minneapolis" me, Captain! ... I'm sorry, I just did it again.

Fields.MenuText: I think maybe you should try a different approach with people you don't know.
Minneapolis, just treat people like people.
Do you want me to let you know what I think of your accent?

Fields.DialogueText: What approach is there, Captain? I've been trying everything from food to topics of weather to sports gossip...
... People like they're people? What do you mean, Captain?
We have an accent? ... Oh god, wait. "Really round the shore we'll have some fun right now"... Oh GOD! We *do* have an accent!
Minneapolis, what I'm saying is: try to get past all the "weird" things a person does and just see them for them, y'know?
But Captain, isn't it normal to point out anything you see as weird or interesting?
In nature and in art, probably. Doing it to some random person you barely know is just going to get them pissed.
... Captain, what do I do when I pick up on things like that? It's sort of in my job description...
Minneapolis, everyone on this planet is different. It's just like every Belle. That's why we have to give people a little respect. It's all a part of being a crew.
... What do we show Morganas, then?
They're an exception.
@BATTLE
Captain, do you have a minute? I've been thinking on what you talked to me about yesterday.
You mean about giving people respect?

Yes, that. I was wondering... I know that everyone's different, but how do I know that what they're doing is... I don't know, normal to them? Why do they do the things they do when they're not normal?

Fields.MenuText: Have you ever heard of the phrase "point of view?"
You have to put yourself in another person's shoes.
Minneapolis...

Fields.DialogueText: Point of view? You mean such as the ones they use in film, or in art where you can see different angles of a painting? How would I use that?
Viewing the world from their eyes... How would I do that when I don't know the first thing about their culture?
Do NOT "Minneapolis" me, Captain. I will not take that sitting down.
It's all about putting things into perspective, really. And just don't ask about it outright. What you need to do is just treat them like your average person.
But they aren't really average...
To you they might not be. But, to their way of living it's normal.
But it's like what Eliezer does at night! He speaks in that guttural tongue and keeps others up, isn't that strange!?
What if I told you that what he's doing is prayer? It's much like how you would do yours.
T-That's prayer!? It sounds like chanting to the devil!
Imagine how others view your woodburning, then? Or the abundance of cooked goods? Would people think that's strange?
Captain, those are--
What would you say if someone came up to you and called your Marines jersey weird? What if another Belle called you weird for the way you talked?
... I think I'm starting to understand your point, Captain. But how do I make things right with the others?
A relationship is built from the ground up, Minneapolis. It starts with the simple things and then slowly builds. Think of it like a rubber band ball.
Where do I even begin with this, Captain?
It's about taking that first step and leaving all of your prebuilt images at the door. Speaking of doors...
I'm going to treat that Morgana like one of those images and kick her out!
@BATTLE
Minneapolis! Ma'am! Nothing to report here!
At ease, Eliezer. I didn't come here to make you scared again. Tell me, do you have any opinions on the cooking I did the last booyah party?
Yes! Actually, I really enjoyed the kugel. It's not often you find someone that makes my favorite dish AND with potato. Please, ma'am, never let it be said that you aren't great at cooking.
Oh, I'm so glad! I spent days consulting both regular cookbooks for hot potato pie and then specially reading some Jewish cookbooks. They really know their stuff.
Hell yes, we do! And... damn, ma'am. Permit me to say that your cooking is the best. I haven't been able to cook myself and I've been looking to do so.
Would you like to join me, Eliezer? I'll be cooking shepherd's pie later this evening. It isn't... um... kosher? But even if you didn't eat it you could get a feel for the galley.
Hey. I may be Jewish, but you put something that smells good in front of me, and... I mean, I'm only human. Just don't tell my mom.
I'll see you soon, Eliezer...! ...Ah, there he goes. Young boys like that, I swear. They're so full of energy...

Fields.MenuText: Hey, you did it!
And THAT is what we call taking another's point of view.
Who's that kind and considerate girl? Can I talk to her?

Fields.DialogueText: I did..? I did! I can't believe it worked! Thank you, Captain! Thank you so much!
I'm starting to see the appeal! Thank you so much for helping me, Captain. I'll admit, I was kind of scared...
Pah! False flattery will get you nowhere, Captain! ... Still, thank you. Thank you for both helping me and sticking by me like this.
It's no problem, Minneapolis. We're all a team, aren't we? Like I said, you've got to level with others.
I can see the merits of doing so. And now I feel some cooking coming on. Would you care to join me, Captain?
Depends, do you think you'd be good for working up an appetite?
Oh dear, oh dear... What's a mother to do?
I didn't know Belles had children!
*giggle*... *snrk!* Ehahahahaha! Oh, Captain..! Hahahaha! T-That's perfect! I can't... stop... laughing!
@BATTLE
I'd love to come cook later and... HEY! What are you two doing over there!? You're going to hurt yourselves!
So, I was minding my own business, when... Hey, Joe! What brings you here?
I could ask the same question. I haven't even finished the dessert yet!
I'm sorry to interrupt you both. But I've got a situation I wanted to talk to a higher up about. You see, me and a couple others feel that we're not getting our fair share.
Your fair share? Do you mean someone's been welching on your pay, Joe?
... Joe. Please tell me who is responsible right this second. I feel the need to... *ahem* talk to them.

Fields.MenuText: Calm down, Minneapolis. Joe, please explain what's wrong?
Joe, are you sure someone's witholding your pay?
If I find out someone's been witholding my crew's wages, there will be hell to pay.

Fields.DialogueText: It's true, Captain. It's not only me and the Sioux, but Marcus and some others have been as well. We're being robbed blind.
We have definitive proof, Captain. We compared our pay with Eliezer's and it doesn't add up. He may be a rank above us, but we're supposed to earn the same wages.
Your enthusiasm is almost as fierce as big sister here. Please, look at these ledgers. I'm sure you'll find out that there will be plenty of hell to dish out.
... You're right, these records are ass backwards. Who's doing this?
We're unsure, but Feng is convinced it's one of the COs who doesn't really like anyone of a darker skin tone.
Hold a moment, Joe. This is my specialty. Captain, would it be acceptable to call a meeting later? I believe I have to inform everyone about the rights of the worker.
I'd be insulted if you didn't call one. We'll gather everyone who's having trouble later. Joe, if the problem should persist afterward, come to me and I'll take it to the higher-ups.
Thank you very much, Captain, Minneapolis. Both I and the others are in your debt. ... Er, are you all right, big sister? Captain..?
Forgive me, I'm about to lose my... Ooooogh... Hmhmhmhm.
I think we could all use some time to blow off some steam. Fortunately, from what I can see outside, we'll have that chance. Joe, Minneapolis, come with me. We have some trouble to deal with.
It'd be my honor, Captain.
... Captain?
Yes, Minneapolis?
After the meeting, can we relax... Perhaps together? I'd like to show you pyrography.
Absolutely, I'd love to. For now though, let's burn these Morganas up.
@BATTLE
I'd take this up with my immediate superior, but the other guys I talked to... well, we all joined up from the same reservation, and they're affected too. Do you see where I'm going with this?
Welcome! Welcome, everyone! Thank you all for coming. I'll let the Captain start us off. Captain?
Thank you, Minneapolis. Now. It's come to my attention that several of you have been experiencing unannounced cuts into your wages, is that correct?
Yes! *murmuring* That's right. *murmuring* It ain't fair! *murmuring* What should we do, Captain? *murmuring* I swear, if I find out who's doing this... *murmuring*
Okay! That's a yes! Knowing that, both Minneapolis and I have called this meeting to inform you. We'll be telling you what you can do, what your rights are, and what you're entitled to in the future.
*general murmuring of understanding*
Excellent! I'll let Minneapolis take it from here.
Thank you, Captain! Ahem! So, everyone! Lately I've been hearing about wage disparities between all of you, and that makes me upset. Very, very upset. Therefore, I will be lecturing you today!
*murmuring of wariness*
Now! Now... I promise you all that I'll make it easy to understand. Now, let's start with what happened last year: the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938. Let's start with...
AN HOUR AND MANY OTHER EXPLANATIONS OF WORKERS' RIGHTS LATER...
... and remember! All of you are entitled to fight for your rights! After all, that's the first amendment! Now, are there any questions?
I have one, big sister. What should we do if we're threatened with expulsion?
Immediately report it to either me or the Captain and we will take care of it!
Captain! I got a question! What'll happen if they dock us further? What should we do then?

Fields.MenuText: Immediately report it to me. I'll handle it.
You're a New Yorker, Marcus. Try and take a guess what I'll do!
I'm going to take pages from Minneapolis' book.

Fields.DialogueText: I will, thank you, Captain. Seriously. That means a ton.
Ah, hell yeah! Give 'em hell for us, Captain!
... Minneapolis is already terrifying with that stuff. I don't wanna KNOW what you're like. Good luck, Captain.
I will do my best, Marcus. Does anyone else have any questions?
No, Captain!
Excellent! Then I'd like to conclude this meeting with some final words from Minneapolis!
Er... Captain, we have company, it seems.
... Let me ask you all another question: do you have pent-up aggression, and would you like to get it out?
AYE-AYE!
Well, then let's be about it!
@BATTLE
Oh! Come in, Captain! Don't mind me, I'm just finishing up my pyrography.

Fields.MenuText: Wow, there's a ton of art in here.
It's neat and tidy...
Lovely room for a lovely lady.

Fields.DialogueText: To be fair, I told you I collected this stuff, didn't I?
Of course! I even laid out the carpet for you so you can wipe your feet at the door.
Why thank you, Captain... It's true, my room is lovely. ... But I'm glad you find me alluring as well.
... Minneapolis? Is it me, or are you burning that wood a bit darker than normal?
Oh no, Captain. I'm... fine... I'm just trying to get some of my... aggression... out.
Minneapolis, stop! You're going to burn right through the thing!
C-Captain! Give me that back! You know having that needle while it's hot is dangerous - you'll burn yourself!
Minneapolis, I want you to tell me what's going on. I'm not giving you this back until you do. You could've burned right through it!
...Captain, it's Eliezer's commanding officer. He confronted me this morning and we came to words. He berated me for trying to give money to "them" and called me a "commie." I was... *sniffle*
I may not understand much about people whose cultures are different than mine, but robbing the worker - the common man - out of what he's owed is... I can't forgive it! They're our family, and I...!
Minneapolis... I'm so sorry. I'll deal with this right away - it's just unacceptable. Come here, I'll calm you down.
Captain... I held my tongue during my talk with him, but I could tell my "niceness" was coming out. I'm... *sniffle* I would've been ashamed if I let myself get out of hand.
There's nothing to be ashamed about, Minneapolis. You did the right thing. For now, I say we--
*ALARM*
Kuh... Duty calls, I guess. Minneapolis, do you think you'll be okay for battle?
With you at my side, Captain... I'll do my best. Let's go.
@BATTLE
Well now, this is the biggest booyah party I've seen yet.
Indeed! ... And there's a ton of new faces as well. ... And a lot of cultures I don't know about.
You'll be ok, Minneapolis. Remember what I said: point of view! Just keep that in mind and you'll be golden.
B-But, Captain... What if I flounder again? I don't want to be in that awkward situation again...

Fields.MenuText: People make mistakes, Minneapolis. Just apologize and move on.
Do your best and be aware. That's all you can do.
Minneapolis, I promise. I'll be right here by your side to help.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain... Right! It's a party, after all. Why spoil a good time!?
That's all we can do at the end of the day! I'll do what I can...
P-Promise!? ... Captain, that's so sweet. All right! Let's do this together!
Good evening, Captain. ... Hello to you, Minneapolis. This party is wonderful.
F-Feng! Listen, about last week, I need to apologize! I didn't mean to talk about your accent like that...
Please, push it out of your mind. You're not the first one to comment on my accent, and you certainly won't be the last.
Thank you, Feng... How are you enjoying the food? Ah! Is that one of my homemade corn dogs I spy?
Yeah, it is. Marcus is quite the fan, too.
Hello, Captain and Minneapolis! This party's bumping up big time. I'm having such a blast, and this food's to die for! This apple pie alone is worth all of it...
I will admit: while I do prefer moon cakes, this apple pie is simply delectable. A nice surpise indeed.
Moon cakes? I've never heard of them before... Do you have a recipe on hand, Feng? I'd like to try to make them.
A cook as good as you attempting to create moon cakes? Why, I'm already looking forward to it. I'll provide you with one as soon as we find Joe and Eliezer... Where are they, Marcus?
Yeah, uh, was about to say: we've got some trouble incoming... There's a ton of Morganas off port!
Ack! Then there's no time to waste! Battlestations, everyone!
Ooohoohoo... You all know how much I dislike *uninvited* guests.
@BATTLE
Hm? I don't remember there being a mural here... Wait. This wood - that signature...!
Good afternoon, Captain! Unfortunately, lunch won't be ready for another hour. Can I do anything for you in the meantime? Perhaps offer you a scone?
Did you do this, Minneapolis? It's beautiful.
Why, yes I did! I wanted to try something new. I usually do landscapes and forests, so I decided to look for some new material.

Fields.MenuText: It's so accurate. It feels like I'm looking at Harlem from a balcony.
I can almost smell the hot dogs, hot coffee, and sea breeze.
... I'm at a loss for words, Minneapolis. This makes my heart sing.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm so glad you love it! Marcus and some of the other people from Harlem loved it, too! They loved it so much, they gave me new recipes!
Hmhm! Marcus and the others from Harlem said the same thing! Lucky you, I'm making coffee right now. I'd offer you a cup if I wasn't busy with lunch.
Wow... This has been the first time I've brought somebody to silence in a positive way. Marcus and the others loved it, but Captain... T-Thank you!
This is extremely beautiful, Minneapolis. I'm glad that you've made this. Hm... Can I have some scones?
You may! Please let me know how they taste! I'm going to make sure some make their way into the next booyah party.
Mmm! Nice, fluffy, sugary, sweet! I don't know why you think you need more firepower when you've got enough here alone.
You can never be too prepared, Captain. Paul Bunyan was very much the same. With his mighty blue ox he swept through the plains!
I'll put in a word to Command about it. Right now we've got other things to worry about. There've been more Morganas about lately.
A few days ago Marcus said they were getting restless - I was kind of hoping he was wrong. What do you think we should do, Captain?
Stay on our toes, that's what. The enemy could be at any place at any time.
... There's a Morgana right outside the window behind me, isn't there?
... Yes. Shall we proceed?
Way ahead of you.
@BATTLE
Luckily, Marcus got a postcard from Harlem, so I decided to draw the skyline of it!
Speaking of which, would it be too out of the question to ask for extra motors? I feel sluggish.
*cheering* *yelling* *raucous laughter*
Come one, come all! There's plenty of things to go around. You've all worked so hard!
If there's anyone that's been working hard, it's you, Minneapolis. Logistically speaking, these parties take a lot of effort to put up.
Why do you think I loathe uninvited guests!? The Morganas always seem to come at the most inopportune times.

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't talk about them so lightly, they're kind of our main enemy...
If you speak of the devil...
I've never heard someone put it that way before...

Fields.DialogueText: They may be! However, I will not have them ruin what the crew has so clearly earned.
... he shall appear! Honestly, Captain. That's an old wives' tale. Just because we talk openly about them doesn't mean they'll suddenly come.

Sometimes it needs a Belle's touch. If you take away their fangs, the Morganas aren't anything but nuisances. If they want to join the party, they'll put their name on the register like everyone else.
I suppose so. Oh! The moon cakes you said you'd make for Feng last time are here... Well, might as well try one!
Go ahead, and please let me know what you think of them!
Aaaah...
*rowdiness* Morganas! *scrambling* *screaming* All hands! *shouting*
Well, wouldn't you know it...
Minneapolis?
... I'm going to come unglued.
Remind me to get some stronger adhesive next time! Let's keep this party going!
@BATTLE
Minneapolis! Be careful, don't go too far out!
Oh, forgive me, Captain. I'm just... Rrrgh! *sigh* I'm so tired. All I wanted to do was to bring everyone together and help acknowledge the hard work they put in... is that too much to ask!?

Fields.MenuText: The Morgana wouldn't care either way.
It's not your fault, Minneapolis.
Minneapolis, I promise it'll get better. I'll try and make it better.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, if they don't care about the party, I shouldn't have to care about their lives. Simple, no? Rrgh, I wish there was a faster way to get rid of them!
I-I know it isn't, but this isn't fair at all! The crew has been working so hard for this! I even made all of the dishes they requested... And these Morganas have the audacity to ruin this night!
*sigh* B-But... Grgh, damn it all, Captain! I know you can, but I don't want to wait! I want to make it better now! I want them to go away, and there's too many of them!
Well, Minneapolis... If you'd turn around, I think you've got a surprise of your own waiting for you.
What are you talking about... huh? Ah! Everyone!
We are Sioux, big sister. What's more, we are warriors. We deserve to celebrate.
Ah! Joe! You're already...
He's right. I ain't about to let a bunch of ghosts ruin my party time 'cause they feel like it! Pass me a rifle, Joe!
M-Marcus! Ah! Feng, Eliezer!
Look at them all out there, standing around like ducks, holding their toys like they just bought them. *click* I'm about to show them why they call me a sharpshooter.
If there's anything my people love, it's good food. And I'd say it's about time we show the Morgana how to party. Say the word, Captain...
AYE-AYE! ALL PRESENT! ALL READY!
*sniff* ...Everyone! I-I'm going to...
You see, Minneapolis? This is what happens when you put yourself in other people's shoes. Now, what do you say we put on our good shoes and push these rabblerousers back?
*sniff* *teardrop* ...Let's do it. LET'S DO IT! SKOL!
SKOL!
@BATTLE
Excellent work, everyone! But it looks like there's more of them coming...
Agh, you've got to be kidding me!? What do we do!?
They're like barnacles almost... They won't go away.
I'm stumped. This ain't good.
Damn... Just when we were winning. How is the party going to continue now!?

Fields.MenuText: The party won't stop.
I've got an idea.
I'd like to eat with you tonight, Minneapolis.

Fields.DialogueText: What do you mean it won't...?
You do!? How are we supposed to combat this and have a party at the same time!? It's ludicrous!
I-I'd love to as well, Captain, but this isn't the time to muse about dinner by the night sky!
What I'm suggesting is that we party in shifts. We have many people: COs, engineers, marines, and everyone in between. They've all worked hard during the week, but they'll work harder for a party.
Captain... Ah! I think I get what you're saying. Basically, we all attack the Morganas in waves, then when we're done beating them we party, and we keep swapping?
Doing this with soldiers... Are you sound of mind, Captain?
Sometimes I ask that question myself. But, if we do this, everyone should have their fair share. Now, who'd like to volunteer first?
Captain! ... Can we go first? I have some... I just want to talk to these Morganas. Perhaps have a little bit of heart to heart?
...T-This murderous intent... Is this big sister's wrath..?
Hell, get OUT of her way!
You heard the woman! Everyone! Keep on partying! And when I call for you to come in, you pick up a rifle, or man the gun, and start firing! Do I make myself clear!?
AYE-AYE!
Tally-ho then! ... Minneapolis? Minneapolis!?
Hello, hello, hello, Morganas... I'm the fair host of this party... Now, can I please ask what you're all doing here uninvited..?
(Important lesson learned. Minnesotans, though quiet and reserved take partying like the gospel.)
@BATTLE
Looks like it's our turn again, Minneapolis.
Have they not learned their lesson yet?
Evidently not. There's a big wave incoming.
Well, Captain... Allow me to... Well, I'd like to let you know about one of my big pet peeves. Do you mind if I share?

Fields.MenuText: Huh, I didn't know this party also had show and tell.
Not at all. Go ahead.
What else do you have to share other than this? Curious.

Fields.DialogueText: It'll be brief, Captain, don't worry!
Thank you very much, Captain. I'll elucidate my... Grrrgh... Pet peeves! Pet peeves... Yes!
I'd love to share this lovely evening with you. But instead, I've got to stake my claim this night.
I don't like that I do all of this work, make new bridges with my Captain, and figure out how to make new and exciting foods... all for these Morganas to ruin it.
But I know why they want to ruin it... It's because they don't have any family of their own.
It's so sad and pathetic that it bears ignoring. But then they come here to our party, uninvited, with intention to harm, and expect US to serve them. They need to be taught proper manners.
If these guys got rid of their cobwebs, flames, and gloomy attitudes, they'd be so much happier, and I'd let them on!
And then once they're all done with that, each one of them will spend the entire day apologizing to each member of the crew, and then be forced to watch the party from afar.
... So this is the true form of Minnesota Nice?
Ohohoh! Captain, Captain, Captain... You haven't seen anything yet.
Then show me more, Minneapolis. We need that kind of firepower right now!
Then come with me, Captain. I'll show you exactly what being "nice" really is...
@BATTLE
They sit there all day in their sad little ghost ships, play spooky with other crews, and just float about like a bunch of freeloading devils.
... After they swab the decks, clean the rudder, and spend an entire day in the boiler room.
That way, they can learn the true value of work before play.
Looks like we've got one more left, Minneapolis.
Ohohoh! You silly Morgana, you! It looks like *someone* needs to learn a lesson!
... I think this is the first time I've seen a Morgana tremble with fear.
@BATTLE
Hope you enjoyed your lesson! Now remember! Next time, make sure you're on the ledger - and *don't* ever come at me with that *horseradish* again.

Fields.MenuText: Never come to a booyah party uninvited.
I've seen hellfire, and now I've seen cold hellfire.
*gasp* Minneapolis! Please, watch your profanity!

Fields.DialogueText: I thought that was obvious, but apparently, the Morgana are dense! Oh... Silly me, that's not right. They're more... oblivious...
You've clearly never been through a Minnesota winter before. That'll make a Captain like you cold to the core and have you begging for summer again.
W-Wha!? Oh dear, I did say "horseradish," didn't I? Ah! No! I said it againnnnn!
Ah! Captain, I'm sorry for that display, that was completely out of left field. I didn't mean to spook or scare you or anyone else! Please forgive me!
Don't apologize for standing up for yourself. Besides, aren't you forgetting something important?
Oh..! That's right! The party! Er, Captain, I made moon cakes this time! Would you please try one?
Absolutely!
... Well, how is it? Feng told me they were delcious, but he said to make the ones with azuki beans.
It melts in your mouth and gives that subtle hint of creaminess with the filling. ... Minneapolis, this is superb. But you know what makes it better?
The sweet taste of victory as a bit of a side?
Damn straight.
Minneapolis, have you seen my - oh! Crap, I'm sorry!
No, it's all right, Captain, you can come in! *chuckle* Even though I'm a Belle, I felt so hot and bothered after that battle that I felt a bath was necessary.
I could go for one myself if I wasn't so busy cleaning up after the rest of the party.
Grr! They didn't leave you with that alone, did they!?
No, not at all, I always stay after to clean up. I try to help out the crew whenever I can, you know?
Captain... There's actually something I want to tell you. I've been wanting to tell you it for a while, but I haven't had time.

Fields.MenuText: If it's about the moon cakes, don't worry. I made sure to put them on ice.
Is it about the wood burning thing?
I'm all ears, and I always will be.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! Thank you! Those things can easily fall appart if they aren't refrigerated, but no, Captain. I want to talk to you about something else.
No, not at all. I'm glad you actually took that out of my hand. I was worried I might've burnt the wall! But I want to talk to you about something important.
Captain... I've already filled myself up on sweets and here you are trying to give me an aftertaste! I won't tolerate snacking after eight! But anyway, I need to tell you...
What do you want to tell me about, Minneapolis?
I want to thank you. Without you, I don't think I could've mended the relationships with Marcus, Eliezer, and Feng easily.
If I wasn't careful, I would've maybe caused some of them to leave. And then you taught me about points of view and... Captain, I feel like a new girl. Thank you, thank you so much.
As both a captain and as a human, it's no problem. We grow, fight, and celebrate together. That's how we roll, and I think that's how every captain should be.
It's a stellar mindset, and one that I happen to agree with! Ah... Hey... Captain?
Yeah, Minneapolis?
... Would you mind, after you cleaned up, listening to the radio together while I bathe? I want to hear the game tonight.
Ah, that's right, there's one happening tonight, isn't there? Well, I suppose. I should go get some popcorn or some --
*ALARM*
Ooogh, of *all* the--
Don't worry, Minneapolis, I'll take care of it. You just focus on your bath. Just make sure you're backing me up with guns, alright?
Will you be all right, Captain?
Of course I will, I've got you and the crew. Oh! Make sure you turn that radio back on. I won't be long!
@BATTLE
Joe I'm more familiar with, since he's Sioux, but with the others I was floundering.
Good afternoon, Minneapolis! Hm? What's that you got there?
It's a flag of St. Paul, of course! I figured that if I kept one of her around, she'd awaken sooner.
St. Paul... your Twin City sister. Figure she'll be like the place?
I hope so, Captain! It's a lovely city, filled with a rich, vibrant nightlife, friendly workers, and so many restaurants that your head will spin! I hear such nice things.

Fields.MenuText: I hear it's got a bit of trouble within the inner city.
Given what I've heard, it's lovely if you have a lot of money...
Beneath every layer of paint is a coat of rust.

Fields.DialogueText: Inner city problems!? Preposterous. The last time I checked, we didn't have any! Well, except for the soap factory. They're having some trouble.
Ack, those wealthy, stepping on the rights of the worker. I can assure you, Captain. The Twin Cities are not at all like that - everyone has a place to live in!
Captain, these are the Twin Cities! It's not like the Bronx or Detroit! I assure you, nothing is wrong there.
We just came out of a depression, and some people are more worse for wear than others. You've got to admit that.
Yes, I understand that. However, there's no problem that a blue-collar worker can't get themselves out of. We're in a time of opportunity!
Opportunity? Yes. War? Yes. Equality...? Not so much. Panic's spreading in those streets, and I worry about the people. Sometimes, I wonder if it might be my own crew there one day.
Well, they're in good hands. Minneapolis and St. Paul will protect them both: I'm sure of it!
I have no doubt you as Belles would, but these are cities. The only allegiances they have are to either themselves or to the rich. It's that simple.
... I wish it didn't have to be that way. Erm, Captain, please. Trust me on this one. The Twin Cities aren't that bad. I assure you, they aren't.
I'll trust you for now. I still worry, of course. Oh, by the way, have you heard the news?
What news?
We'll be heading to Europe once our business is finished here.
Ahahaha! Yes! Finally, I may be able to visit Norway and Sweden! I've yearned to visit them for so long... Oh, what art do you think we'll find?
... Care to paint a portrait of a Morgana for now? It'd look good.
Hmm... What does this need..? Ah! I know: a few salvos to the face.
@BATTLE
Minneapolis! Are you in here? I wanted to talk to you about cooking.
Hello, Captain! You've caught me at an odd time. I'm just finishing up some Aegean okra. What would you like to know about?

Fields.MenuText: I want to learn how to cook for myself.
Can you teach me the way of pastries?
I want to know your methods of cooking. You do it so wonderfully!

Fields.DialogueText: Why, Captain! You're a Captain, you shouldn't need to spend any time cooking right now! Buuuut, I can see why you'd want to learn. Come here, I'll show you.
You have a good eye, Captain. Pastries are simultaneously a master craft while also being child's play. Right now, I'm making some moon cakes and some apple turnover.
Why, Captain, I'm flattered. You can stand right beside me and I'll go ahead and elaborate! *chuckle* Keep your eyes on the dough.
So! Here I've got the dough for turnovers. Now, it's very important that the first thing you do for cooking is to wash your hands. Can you do that for me, Captain?
Yep! *creak creak* *fsssh*
Make sure you get all of it out! The fingernails are usually the ones where it's the hardest.
Okay! Done.
Fantastic. Now, it's very important that you have everything in place before you start. Mis en place. That's French for "all in place". Now, let's start with making dough.
Now, I'll place this flour in this mixer bowl and add some cold butter. Oh! Important note: remember that unless stated otherwise, butter is usually room temperature.
Ok, now mix gently... Next, you'll want to add some really cold water and some salt. Now this is the important part. You've got to mix it by hand while also keeping it cold. You try, Captain!
Knead, mix, knead, mix, knead, mix...
Beautiful! And now just do that a bit more. Oh! Make sure you're using enough pressure, but not to where it causes heat. We don't want to melt the butter.
Now, tell me, Captain. Do you prefer Granny Smith apples or brae-
*ALARM*
Whew! Let's continue this later. I'll wrap this dough up and put it in the fridge. That's right, right?
Exactly! But now, we'll have to do some extra kneading. These Morganas could use some...
@BATTLE
And there we go! Puff pastry for the turnover!
Ah, it feels so rare to see the coastline so clearly. Are we doing some kind of training exercise today?
Why would you ask me that, Captain? That's information only you'd have.

Fields.MenuText: Bold of you to assume anyone tells me anything.
I unfortunately do not have all the answers.
Well, you're quite knowledgeable about the crew yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Miscommunication? What are we, the Golden Gophers at Notre Dame?
Damn! And here I was thinking you had most of them.
Captain! ... That's true, I am knowledgeable. But you shouldn't sell yourself short either. You're no slouch. You sure you don't have them?
No dice, I'm afraid. ... Hm? Is that a forest over here?
Oh! It is! If I weren't confined to this ship, I'd ask you to go birdwatching.
Hobby of yours?
Well, one aspect of it. There's something so wonderful about getting up in the morning, hearing the noise of nature, watching the birds fly, swimming in the lake, and resting near the stars...
I can see it now... What else would you do in nature?
Why, roast your catches of the day near the campfire, sleep in a tent and hear the sounds of the night, and then wake up to the most beautiful sunrise. The landscapes of Minnesota, Captain.
They sound heavenly. I'll definitely have to check them out with you one day.
You mean... Do you know of a way to...
I wish I did. For now, we'll have to settle for the river rides. Maybe we'll have time after the mission in Europe? Who knows...
Ah, yes, I'd very much love that. The birdsong, careful trickling water, and the...
It most certainly was.
Captain?
Yes, Minneapolis?
... I'm upset.
Understood, Minneapolis. Let's roll.
@BATTLE
*GUNFIRE*
That was Morganas, wasn't it?
Well, Minneapolis. They've finalized our trip. Soon we'll begin training and then head out.
It's about time! I've already started on my newest mural. It should be completed by the time we finish in Europe.
Who knows? Deadlines have a mysterious way of working. Anyway, I guess we've made quite a name for ourselves if they want us to head to Europe.
Well, we're the only Belle and Captain combo I know of who actually throw booyah parties. And, my cooking's starting to get popular, too!
I wouldn't doubt it, you're amazing.
An amazing Belle should have an amazing Captain, should she not?
Well, you know I can't take all of the credit. Especially not after you helped get the crew up to speed on worker's rights.
Oh! That's right! Joe told me that the payment problems have been resolved! What happened to that commanding officer?
He got transferred. From what the higher-ups said, it's somewhere out in the boonies.
Serves him right! Power to the people!
Damn right.
Hahaha! ...You know, Captain, when I first picked you, I had no idea this was how it was going to end up!
It's really been a wild ride, hasn't it? Parties, working, cooking, copious amounts of Morganas, and a bit of a traffic accident at some points. But that's what makes it charming.
Absolutely... I just hope that Europe is more of the same.
You'll never know, life likes to surprise you like that.
Whatever comes our way, I'll look forward to doing it with you, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: And me to you, Minneapolis. Let's keep this rolling.
I couldn't see myself anywhere else. Not without you by my side.

Fields.DialogueText: Skol! That's what I like to hear! Who knows what's going to happen next? I hope we go to the north.
... Erm! *ahem* W-Wow. I wasn't expecting that out of you, Captain. I-I hope that we can do our best together as... Goodness...
Expect the unexpected.
No matter where we are, Captain. I've got a feeling that the north will always be with us. Guiding us like the star in the night sky.
Amen.
